item.title: Gracious Alert
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

I receive a lot of feedback saying that they’re unhappy about the in-game alert pop-up box being used as it causes havoc when they’re in the wilderness or duelling. I’ve written a new method which is a gracious way of doing this for not-so-important in-game alerts.

For example, when you receive a PM on the forum you receive a pop-up box in-game but any player could spam you with PM’s to make things awkward for you. This is no longer possible as there’s simply no point in doing it.

public void sendGraciousAlert(final String alert) { if (getLocation().inWilderness() || isDueling || isDMing || isTrading || accessingBank() || accessingShop()) { World.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new SingleEvent(null, 1000) { public void action() { sendGraciousAlert(alert); } }); } else sendAlert(alert); }
All the code does is simply try every second until it’s possible to send the alert (when they’re not in the wilderness, not dueling, not in a trade screen, not in a duel screen, not in a DM screen, not in a bank screen and not in a shop screen).
